page.title: 20MILLOM FELL RESCUE TEAM
page.content: MILLOM HAS A MOUNTAIN RESCUE TEAM WITH ABOUT 35 MEMBERS. THEY ARE ALL VOLUNTEERS AND HAVE JOBS IN THE LOCAL SCHOOLS, PRISON, FACTORIES, ETC. THE TEAM WAS FORMED AFTER A PLANE CRASHED ON BLACK COMBE ABOUT TWENTY YEARS AGO. UNLIKE SOME OF THE VERY BUSY TEAMS, MILLOM ONLY GETS A FEW CALL-OUTS EACH YEAR AND OCCASIONALLY HELP IS GIVEN TO FARMERS WHO HAVE SHEEP BURIED IN SNOW DRIFTS. EACH MONTH THERE IS A PRACTICE WHEN TEAM MEMBERS GET TOGETHER AND GO THROUGH THE PROCEEDURES THAT ARE USED IN REAL ACCIDENTS OR SEARCHES. THE TEAM USES A FORD TRANSIT CREW BUS TO CARRY EQUIPMENT, LIKE RADIOS, ROPES, A STRETCHER AND FIRST AID SACKS, TO ANY INCIDENT. ALL THE MONEY TO KEEP THE TEAM GOING COMES FROM GRANTS OR FROM FUND RAISING EFFORTS BY TEAM MEMBERS. {ALWAYS TAKE GREAT CARE ON THE FELLS.}
